title: [Neuroscience] Brain Builds and Uses Maps of Social Networks, Physical Space, in the Same Way - “We know a lot about how the neural codes for representing physical space. It looks like the human brain uses the same codes to organize abstract, nonspatial information as well.”

[Medicine] Scientists unravel how the immune checkpoint protein PD-L2 is regulated, which has potential implications in immune therapy. The molecule has been extensively explored as a target protein in immunology. But, despite years of research, exactly how this protein gets regulated has remained unclear.
